title: Factoring a Trinomial
text: To factor a trionomial $${ax}^2+bx+c$$, the first step is to find $$p$$ and q, a pair of factors of ac with a sum of $$b$$.
speech: To factor a trionomial  a x squared, plus b x plus, c , the first step is to find  p  and q, a pair of factors of ac with a sum of  b .

title: Rewriting the Expression
text: The second step is to rewrite the original expression as $${ax}^2+px+qx+c$$.
speech: The second step is to rewrite the original expression as  a x squared, plus p x plus q x plus c .

title: Greatest Common Factor (GCF)
text: Thirdly, pull out the GCF of $${ax}^2+px$$.
speech: Thirdly, pull out the GCF of , a x squared, plus p x .

title: Greatest Common Factor (GCF)
text: Then, pull out the GCF of $$qx+c$$.

title: Factoring out the GCF
text: Lastly, factor out the GCF of the expression.
